title: Meet Isai
text: Hi! My name is Isai (think Açaí → Içaí). I’m currently a student at the UNC School of Education working toward a PhD in Education Policy with a PhD minor in Computer Science. If I’m not at my desk you can find me jogging, hiking a mountain trail, kayaking, or back at my desk digging for gold in Deep Rock Galactic or Minecraft.

title: Data and Programming
text:
Machine Learning: Python (scikit-learn, imbalanced-learn, statsmodels, pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, TensorFlow)
Programming: Python, R, STATA, SPSS
Reporting and Data Visualization: Jupyter Notebook, Matplotlib , R Markdown, ggplot2, Quarto
Version Control: Git, GitHub
Data Collection: Survey development (RedCap, SurveyMonkey, SurveyGizmo), focus groups, interviews in English, Spanish
Statistical Expertise: Causal Inference, Statistical Modelling, Machine Learning, Econometrics
An aside, I am fascinated by understanding real world relationships from data. The messier and more complex the problem seems, the more intrigued I am to make sense of it.

title: Research Interests
text:
I’m interested in the role of higher education for socioeconomic mobility of first generation students and students of color and the application of causal inference and machine learning methods to these questions.
Specifically I’m interested in:

Identifying causal mechanisms for the under-representation of women and students of color in the STEM pipeline.
Understanding role of unequal distribution of opportunity on college admission, persistence and completion.
Long term outcomes of students after they leave higher education as a function of major choice, college choice, and debt burden.
